name: DoorDash
summary: DoorDash is an on-demand delivery service.
description: DoorDash is a technology and logistics company that started with on-demand door-to-door delivery. It empowers local businesses to connect with people through their platform of diners and dashers.

name: Nubank
summary: Nubank provides next-generation mobile banking and financial services to the Latin American market.
description: Nubank is the leading financial technology company in Latin America and the largest independent neobank worldwide, with more than 20 million clients. Initially a no-fee credit card managed by a mobile app, Nubank has since expanded to include a proprietary loyalty rewards program, digital account and personal loans.

name: Zoom
summary: Zoom brings teams together with cloud-based video communications.
description: Zoom provides cloud video conferencing, online meetings, group messaging and a software-defined conference room on one easy-to-use platform. Its product brings teams together so they can connect to others and build toward a future limited only by their imagination.

name: Snowflake
summary: Snowflake is a data warehouse platform built for the cloud.
description: Snowflake powers the data cloud. It is a solution for all things data: warehousing, lakes, engineering, science, application development and sharing. It allows organizations to unite their siloed data, easily discover and securely share governed data, and execute diverse analytic workloads.

name: 23andMe
summary: 23andMe is the leading personal genetics information company.
description: 23andMe is dedicated to helping individuals understand their own genetic information through DNA analysis technologies and web-based interactive tools. The company’s web-based service tells consumers what their DNA says about their health, traits and ancestry.

name: Apple
summary: Apple transforms how humans interact with technologies with products like the iPhone, iPod, iPad, Mac and Watch.
description: Apple revolutionized personal technology with the Macintosh in 1984. It has repeatedly transformed the way humans interact with computers with the iPhone, iPod, MacBook, iMac and other products. Today it is the largest publicly traded company and one of the world’s most recognizable brands. Its forays into the worlds of cloud storage, wearables, music streaming and electric vehicles have proven the company continues to innovate.

name: FTX
description: FTX.COM is a cryptocurrency exchange built by traders, for traders. It offers innovative products including industry-leading derivatives, options and volatility products, tokenized stocks, prediction markets, leveraged tokens and an OTC desk. FTX.COM strives to be an intuitive yet powerful platform for all kinds of users. In less than two years, FTX.COM has become one of the world’s most respected cryptocurrency exchanges.

name: Vanta
summary: Vanta automates and simplifies security and compliance.
description: Vanta automates and simplifies the complex, time-consuming and tedious process of becoming SOC 2-, HIPAA- or ISO 27001-compliant. It integrates and monitors tools and infrastructure, creates to-do lists for gaps, summarizes results, and connects users with a trained auditor.

name: Airbnb
summary: Airbnb connects people around the world with unique homes and unforgettable experiences.
description: Airbnb brought consumers into the sharing economy with its revolutionary peer-to-peer travel marketplace. Today the company connects people around the world with its unique homes and unforgettable experiences.

name: Okta
summary: Okta is an identity-management service that securely and simply connects people to their applications.
description: Okta is the foundation for secure connections between people and technology. Harnessing the power of the cloud, it allows people to access applications on any device, at any time, while enforcing security protections. Okta integrates directly with an organization’s existing directories and identity systems.

name: Stripe
summary: Stripe is building an economic infrastructure for the internet.
description: Stripe is building an economic infrastructure for the internet. Businesses of every size, from new startups to public companies like Salesforce and Facebook, use the company’s software to accept online payments and run technically sophisticated financial operations in more than 100 countries.

name: Square
summary: Square is a payment service that helps more people start, run and grow their businesses.
description: With its combination of intuitive software and beautifully designed hardware, Square is a Swiss Army knife for businesses of any size, covering everything from payment and point-of-sale to financial services.

name: Linear
summary: Linear builds issue tracking tools for developers.
description: Linear helps developers streamline software projects, sprints, tasks and bug tracking without hampering progress.

name: Qualtrics
summary: Qualtrics builds operating systemS for experience management.
description: Qualtrics is a single system of record for all experience data. Initially created to run surveys in the cloud, today Qualtrics allows organizations to manage the four core experiences of business—customer, product, employee and brand experiences—on one platform.

name: Instagram
summary: Instagram, now part of Meta, is the world's most popular photo-sharing app.
description: Instagram changed the way we share photos and video with mobile devices. It enables anyone to connect with more people, build a following and create compelling content that’s distinctly their own. Instagram is now part of Meta.

name: Unity
summary: Unity is a 3D and VR content development platform.
description: Unity is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating interactive, real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Unity’s products equip content creators with the tools to entertain and create innovative RT3D experiences across most industries.

name: WhatsApp
summary: WhatsApp, now part of Facebook, is an end-to-end encrypted mobile messenger app.
description: WhatsApp is an end-to-end encrypted mobile messaging app that lets users send messages free of charge. Acquired by Facebook in 2014, more than 2 billion people in over 180 countries now use WhatsApp to stay in touch.
